title: Will help to increase your hemoglobin numbers

I read up on how to improve this and iron was one way to help this number improve.  I was very pleased to learn my hemoglobin was now well within expected values.  Previously, I wan unable to donate blood because my hemoglobin was too low.  I attribute the new values to this product and taking it daily.

title: Great for Vegetarians who are Prone to Iron Deficiency
body: As a vegetarian, I am often lacking iron in my diet. I am often feeling tired and dull throughout the day. I've tried many other iron supplements and I was turned off by the preservatives and gluten in other products. This product has quickly become apart of my daily routine! I take one tablet in the morning with breakfast and shortly after incorporating this product into my daily regiment I have experienced more energy and stamina throughout my day. I no longer the need my late afternoon caffeine run.  What I really love about this product is it contains no preservatives, gluten or starch - not to mention its easy to absorb.

title: Remember to check for medicine interactions!
body: I'm anemic and usually use This brand (Nature made) or natures way or sundown naturals. I take iron every night and my blood tests have been coming back great for years. Remember to check for medicine interactions. For instance, I cannot take iron at the same time as my thyroid hormones or they will not fully absorb. So I take the iron by itself in the evening.

title: Help brought my blood count back up
body: These Nature made made iron tablets are very good and works efficiently. My blood count  is very low and these tablets are helping me get it back up to a 10-11 count. I take 2 tablets every night. These melt in your mouth as soon as you drink some water. It didn't leaves a nasty after taste in my mouth. They are fast absorbing and didn't leave any discomfort. The price is fair, very affordable and cheaper than the drug store. I highly recommend these tablets for anybody with low blood count.

title: Excellent Product and Value
body: Excellent iron supplement IME. Easy to take, and I have blood test results that prove (at least to me and MY MD.) it is effective. If you are a chewer (these are quite small already) the taste is not unpleasant, sort of like unsweetened, unsalted white bread. There is one side effect for me: It really amps up my dreams. For me, this side effect is pleasant and common to all iron supplements. If one is inclined to night terrors, you will want to take these first thing in the morning, to minimize this side effect. I take mine mid-day, as I have multiple meds I take in the morning and at bedtime.

title: Using These For the Last 5 Years
body: I'm extremely anemic and I have to take iron pills for health reasons. I was told to be careful with these, that they may upset my stomach but I've never had an issue. They are small enough that they are easy to swallow. I have been using this brand for 5 years now. I have given these to other women I know who have issues with anemia.

title: Great, cheap.. but don't overdo it
body: I've bought these many times since I did blood work and was diagnosed as aenemic ie. low iron  though it took months to get back up to where I should be, I am now finally at a normal level to where it's only recommended during menstrual cycle. Women def tend to be more deficient in Iron but it is possible to have too much. I have a friend in college who doubled up on Iron Supplements and ended up being hospitalized. So dont overdo it. You should not be taking these everyday unless your levels are very low, but on a maintenance schedule I would only take a few times a week as each pill is 3x the daily recommended amount.

I purchase them for her and they seem to work great because her red blood count is always where it should be.  The doctor recommended taking these and for years all has been going okay since using them.  They can make you constipated and so you will need to take a couple stool softeners each day.

title: small and easy to swallow, doesnt make stomach upset.
body: I have always been a little anemic my whole life, i never take supplements because they make my poop black and constipated. Plus they are usually large and hard to swallow. These are great! they are really tiny, i can even take without drinking anything. I am 7 mos pregnant and throughout my pregnancy, despite taking Similac pre-natal (when i can remember, because i could only take at night before sleep to avoid an upset stomach) my iron was kinda low (probably because i wasnt taking every single day). My last visit my dr finally told me my iron has fallen below the recommended guideline and to take an iron supplement to avoid having a blood transfusion after giving birth. I bought these based on the rating and reviews. These do not leave me constipated (an already undesirable symptom of pregnancy) and my poop is not black. I feel less weak/tired (for 7 mos pregnant) and i can take these anytime, with or without food, day or night.

title: Great for boosting iron as a regular blood component donor
body: These tablets work so well! I started using them to boost my iron so I could donate platelets more frequently. It used to be that if I tried to donate every two weeks, my iron would be too low the second time so I'd be deferred for a month. So I started scheduling three weeks in between, which usually worked, but sometimes it was still too low and I'd get deferred, even with making a special effort to eat iron rich foods. Since starting this supplement, if I consistently remember to take it, I can donate every other week with no problem, my levels are plenty high. An added bonus is that I think I have more energy too!

title: Good weapon against anemia
body: Anemia is more widespread than most people think.  My anemia comes from post-gastric surgery changes in absorption and even a well-balanced diet (which I don't always have) cannot provide the iron my body needs.  With these tablets I can boost my iron levels easily and I trust the Nature Made brand.  Advice from my dietician  regarding iron supplements: 1. don't take within 4 hours of calcium supplements (they interrupt absorption of each other) and 2. always take with something high in Vitamin C, which helps the body process iron.

title: small and easy to swallow, doesnt make stomach upset.
body: I have always been a little anemic my whole life, i never take supplements because they make my poop black and constipated. Plus they are usually large and hard to swallow. These are great! they are really tiny, i can even take without drinking anything. I am 7 mos pregnant and throughout my pregnancy, despite taking Similac pre-natal (when i can remember, because i could only take at night before sleep to avoid an upset stomach) my iron was kinda low (probably because i wasnt taking every single day). My last visit my dr finally told me my iron has fallen below the recommended guideline and to take an iron supplement to avoid having a blood transfusion after giving birth. I bought these based on the rating and reviews. These do not leave me constipated (an already undesirable symptom of pregnancy) and my poop is not black. I feel less weak/tired (for 7 mos pregnant) and i can take these anytime, with or without food, day or night.

title: An Anemic's SAVIOR
body: I have been anemic my entire life, and have really struggled with finding the perfect iron supplement.  I originally took the regular, doctor-prescribed, synthetic ones...which gave me AWFUL constipation.  I would rather be fatigued and dizzy than go through that.  So, I began my search for a more gastro-friendly iron pill.  I have tried quite a few food/herbal-based iron supplements, and this one is by far my favorite.  Garden of Life makes some incredible vitamins and supplements that I've always loved, so I'm not sure why it took me so long to try this.  But, now that I have, I'll never switch!  My iron labs are finally normal, and I feel great!

title: Recommend to all my patients
body: I needed an iron supplement myself. After using this product for 6 months I began recommending to my patients.  Low iron often goes undetected.  Many providers do not take the time to check it unless you are anemic.  Early signs of low iron can include hair loss, fatigue, muscle cramps.  It is not a routine screen but if your primary care is good they can recognize early signs from a simple blood count.  I can not say enough about this product.  I have recommended a couple other but this is my personal favorite.  My patients love it because they do not experience those unwanted side effects.  Thank you Garden of life for creating the Vitamin Code line.

title: Insufficient information

Ferrous iron salts (ferrous fumarate, ferrous sulfate, and ferrous gluconate) are the best absorbed forms of iron supplements.  It would be nice to know which this product contains.

title: Changed My Life!!
body: I am not one for writing reviews, but someone's review convinced me to purchase this product so I have to pay it forward.  Mega Foods Blood Builders has changed my life!!!

title: End your iron deficiency anemia now!
body: I have been seeing a hematologist for chronic, severe iron deficiency anemia for a few years since I had a gastric bypass and cannot properly absorb nutrients from food. I had tried every single formulation of iron (pills and liquid) possible and could not tolerate them as they made me very nauseous and constipated. I had been racking up the medical bills as I then had to go to the hospital or hematologist for iron I.V. therapy. The I.V. iron gave me joint pain and dropped my blood pressure way too low/got dizzy quite often. I even had a trip to the ER due to an allergic reaction to a different kind of I.V. iron. Thought I'd have to live with the iron I.V. side effects until I stumbled upon Mega Food's Blood Builder. I have been taking it faithfully for 6 months and the last 2 times I had my iron levels tested by my hematologist (I get tested now only every 3 months), I have NOT been anemic. To give you an idea of how anemic I was, I should be a level 13 and I was a 7.  I even take it on an empty stomach without any side effects! My doc wanted to know what I was doing differently and I handed him a copy of the label of Blood Builder so that he can pass this information along to his other anemic patients. I'm doing so well, that he just called me today to say that he no longer needs to see me and to keep taking this supplement! Please give this a try and do be faithful with taking it every day and you'll get great results like I did and hopefully you can also "break up" with your hematologist!

title: Immediate results
body: I have always had low iron levels and the regular iron supplement never seemed to help. After reading the reviews I decided to give this a try. I've been taking it less than one week and take 2 pills a day. Today I tested my hemoglobin and I exceed the normal range. I notice I have more energy as well. Very pleased!!

title: Misleading label. Contains synthetic folic acid
body: I was very disappointed and disturbed to find out that this brand, which I have been using consistently for years, is not what I thought it was. I thought their "food state nutrients" were made wholly from food sources, as the list of ingredients would suggest. It was only by chance I read someone else's review of MegaFood Vit C. That reviewer stated that they called MegaFood and discovered that it was ascorbic acid mixed in with orange peel. That alerted me and so I emailed to inquire about the "folate." Many people have discovered that synthetic folic acid that is not in the methyl form is toxic for them, which is the case for me, so I have been avoiding it (so I thought) for a couple years. I was under the impression that if a label says "folate" it is safe. Sadly I was mistaken. Here was  the reply I received from MegaFood: "The folate in these products are delivered in broccoli, which does have folate naturally occurring, however we do integrate additional folic acid into the broccoli to reach the potency we need..."  I am writing this review in the hopes of saving other people from the bad effects of unknowingly  ingesting synthetic folic acid, and to warn people that the MegaFood labels are misleading.

title: Great
body: I starting taking half a pill about a week ago, because my hair was shedding alot more since I switched to a multivitamin with less Iron in it. After a week, my hair has stopped shedding so much! ((BTW I have been anemic often, been hospitalized 3 times for it, I have to take the maxuim recommend daily dose in a multivitamin to aviod becoming anemic for the last 5 yrs.)) I wouldn't take this product unless you are chronically anemic or only taking for a short while. Because it has a high amount of iron and you don't want to take too much Iron. This product is great because it doesn't make you want to throw up like Iron pills do!

title: Best Iron Supplement On The Market!
body: OMG this iron supplement is a MIRACLE WORKER!!!! I have suffered from anemia for over 20 years. My doctors have always prescribed iron supplements that unfortunately caused severe constipation. In January of this year, my hemoglobin level was 7.5 and I was facing the possibility of needing a blood transfusion prior to a scheduled surgery this spring. I researched this product and decided to try it based on the great reviews I saw. I began taking 2 pills per day for 1 month (1 in the morning and 1 at night). Then I increased the dosage to 3 pills per day in an effort to boost my iron levels quickly. I went to my Dr. yesterday to have my hemoglobin checked and was notified today that it is 13.9!!!! My hemoglobin has NEVER been this good. I am completely satisfied with this product. It has changed my life.

title: Promising discovery!!
body: Hi I don't have a review yet for this product.  I suffer from severe anemia due to fibroids.  I've been able to shrink them utilizing systemic enzymes and I'm very grateful for that.  It has been a long long journey trying naturally cure myself.  Rebuilding my blood is whats imperative at my current stage.  I currently suffer with severe anemia symptoms like horrible fatigue after walking short distances and up stairs or hills.  It literally takes my breath away and my body loses all of its energy to function.  I also have "pica" a incredible desire to chew ice all day, every day.  It gives me the boost of oxygen I need but I'd rather not live this way for the rest of my life! I take a tbl spoon of unsulfured blackstrap molasses everyday and I drink high alkaline water infused with liquid chlorophyll.  I drink that all day, everyday......and I chew chew chew away on ice! LOL

title: Impressively effective. Gives me enough energy to get up and stay up and productive all day.
body: I started taking this about 6 months ago and it has made a quite noticeable and significant difference in my life! I used to really struggle with having enough energy to get up in the morning and work for 8 hours. I also would often get dizzy standing up. This has helped me be much more productive, and more importantly, feel good during the day and not exhausted after a few hours. I have less dizzy spells too. I have never encountered a supplement that has had such a significant, positive effect. It has a slight earthy taste but nothing a few extra gulps of water can't cure.

title: Ferritin levels up from 8ng/mL to 44ng/mL in 4 months
body: I had a fibroid causing ridiculous monthly bleeding (with trips to ER for blood loss). April 2, 2016 my ferritin levels were 8ng/mL . The healthy range is between 22 and 291. I was falling asleep at 9pm every night, waking up feeling more tired than when I went to sleep. My doctor told me to take 325mg  iron sulfate. (Incidentally in months prior, I though they were testing my iron as they were doing blood tests on me and told me my results were fine. I have no idea why they weren't considering my situation. Only after a really crazy period did I ask them if they could 'retest' my iron to discover they hadn't been monitoring it!) I came to Amazon and researched and decided I'd try this instead. I opted for uterine fibroid embolization (done April 11) instead of a hysterectomy. So I'm still losing blood monthly but much, much less. Just had my blood tested yesterday and my ferritin levels are now 44ng/mL. I'm going to get one more bottle of this as I used to have really great iron levels.  No upset stomach or anything from taking it. Just nice results. My CBC test results are almost identical from four months ago. (They were never a concern.) Hope this helps someone and you feel better too!

title: The proof is in the pudding:
body: I was diagnosed with iron deficient anemia from being a frequent blood donor. I'm a 41 year old male and was donating every 8 weeks for over a year. I'm upset with the local blood center, because there is nothing in their literature or on their website about supplementing with iron if you are a frequent donor. Nothing was ever said to me by any of their staff either. If you look at the Red Cross website, you can easily find their recommendation for supplementing with iron if you are a frequent donor.

I used to call it the "heebie jeebie" legs and they made me feel like I wanted to crawl out of my skin.  I spoke to my doctor and she indicated an iron supplement might help.  Not too excited about that as I knew iron could cause constipation. She told me a colleague of hers highly recommended Blood Builder - the colleague had similar reservations about iron supplements but did a lot of research and started using Blood Builder with much success.  I ordered it and started using it right away with no constipation issues at all.  I've been using it now for over 2 years and swear by it.  It seems to have solved my leg problems!!!

title: Gastric Bypass and Fibromyalgia Patients - YOU NEED TO TRY THIS!
body: I had gastric bypass in 2003. A year later, I was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. My iron was low for years but my doctor never made a big deal about it. After taking Lyrica and gaining 50 lbs, I went to a new rheumatologist. My iron level was 3 and my red blood count was so low that he compared it to having just given 2 pints of blood. My resting heart rate was 120-130, I was exhausted and out of breath with the slightest exertion. He sent me to a hematologist and I had 5 weeks of IV iron infusion. Following that, my iron level was 175 and my red blood count was normal. Additonally, my pain was GONE. My cats could walk on me without me screaming. I could run up and down the stairs and not get winded. I felt normal for the first time in 10 years. One month later, my iron was back down to 5 and the pain was back. The rheumatologist said that he has a statistically abnormal number of patients with fibro who have had gastric bypass. He believes that the trauma of the bypass triggers fibro. Additionally, there are fibro studies that directly link pain with iron deficiency. I was excited and ready to get regular IV iron to keep my level high. Unfortunately, you can't get approved for IV iron unless you are anemic. I had tried prescription iron supplements a few times but could not stomach them. I was resigned to the fact that if I wanted to feel good, I would have to deal with the stomach issues and take the supplements. I started googling to find other bypass or fibro people to see what kind of iron they took and I found Blood Builder. I take 3 a day, usually after lunch and never have any problems with an upset stomach. My iron has been building up steadily, so I am hopeful that I will reach a level where the pain goes away again. My rheumatologist was so impressed with it that he has suggested it to other patients - and he is not a supplement kind of guy. Additionally, I have started losing weight without changing my eating habits and not exercising. I read somewhere that low iron affects all kinds of bodily functions, including metabolism. That's a happy side effect!  If you have had bypass surgery and/or you have fibromyalgia, I recommend you try this for a few months. Even if your iron is in the "normal" range, it might need a boost to get you to the level your body requires.

title: I really believe this is some kind of miracle supplement.
body: I have/had severe anemia requiring blood transfusions.  Last year, in the course of 6 months, I had 6 blood transfusions (2 bags of blood each transfusion).  I was looking on Amazon for a book on anemia and on the side where they have suggestions listed I saw this and it made me curious.  When I read the reviews, they were so great, I just had to try it, as my anemia was not getting better following my hematologist's suggestions/orders.  After only one month, taking one a day, it raised my hemoglobin up to 13.0 - the highest it has ever been (it's funny because I read a review and the reviewer said it brought their hemoglobin up to 13 as well).  I couldn't believe it.  It did not only normalize my hemoglobin levels, but after a couple more months, all my blood levels were perfect.  Even my new hematologist told me that he wished his blood levels were as good as mine!  I think this is really like some miracle supplement!  The best part about it is that is from all whole foods.  My first hematologist had me take these iron supplements (ferrous sulfate) that actually messed up my digestive system and made me severely ill (I think they caused gastro-intestinal bleeding), which is why I kept needing blood transfusions.  I would definitely recommend these to anyone having any kind of blood issues.  Another hematologist told me straight out that these supplements wouldn't help me because they don't contain enough iron to bring my levels up, but he was wrong!  It has totally made me see that doctors don't know it all, even the specialists.  If you have anemia, just get this - it can change your life.

title: Helped my Anemia

I knew I was bad when i tried to walk up my stairs in my house (12 steps), and I would be at the top on the floor trying to catch my breath. My doctor prescribed Iron pills but i refused them because I already have chronic constipation. I just happen to come across this product on amazon when i was looking for natural iron pills.  I went on and read the reviews and I loved everything I read, so I gave it a shot. I took 1 pill a day for a week and a half before I saw my doctor again, by then My hemoglobin was 10.2. She told me it was better but she advised me to take 3 pills a day until i could bring it to a normal range. My next appointment wasn't for another month and a half so I just continued to take my 3 pills a day (But i will admit that some days i would forget and maybe take 2, some days would be 1). However when i saw my doctor, my hemoglobin went up to 12. 3, so i am finally in the normal range and I feel 10 times better. I would totally recommend this to anybody because it is natural, and it never made me constipated or upset my stomach. I could take it with food, or on a empty stomach. Some days when i would forget i would just take 2 at the same time before bed, still no discomfort. So if your anemic, i totally recommend it. :)

title: Gastric Bypass and Fibromyalgia Patients - YOU NEED TO TRY THIS!
body: I had gastric bypass in 2003. A year later, I was diagnosed with Fibromyalgia. My iron was low for years but my doctor never made a big deal about it. After taking Lyrica and gaining 50 lbs, I went to a new rheumatologist. My iron level was 3 and my red blood count was so low that he compared it to having just given 2 pints of blood. My resting heart rate was 120-130, I was exhausted and out of breath with the slightest exertion. He sent me to a hematologist and I had 5 weeks of IV iron infusion. Following that, my iron level was 175 and my red blood count was normal. Additonally, my pain was GONE. My cats could walk on me without me screaming. I could run up and down the stairs and not get winded. I felt normal for the first time in 10 years. One month later, my iron was back down to 5 and the pain was back. The rheumatologist said that he has a statistically abnormal number of patients with fibro who have had gastric bypass. He believes that the trauma of the bypass triggers fibro. Additionally, there are fibro studies that directly link pain with iron deficiency. I was excited and ready to get regular IV iron to keep my level high. Unfortunately, you can't get approved for IV iron unless you are anemic. I had tried prescription iron supplements a few times but could not stomach them. I was resigned to the fact that if I wanted to feel good, I would have to deal with the stomach issues and take the supplements. I started googling to find other bypass or fibro people to see what kind of iron they took and I found Blood Builder. I take 3 a day, usually after lunch and never have any problems with an upset stomach. My iron has been building up steadily, so I am hopeful that I will reach a level where the pain goes away again. My rheumatologist was so impressed with it that he has suggested it to other patients - and he is not a supplement kind of guy. Additionally, I have started losing weight without changing my eating habits and not exercising. I read somewhere that low iron affects all kinds of bodily functions, including metabolism. That's a happy side effect!  If you have had bypass surgery and/or you have fibromyalgia, I recommend you try this for a few months. Even if your iron is in the "normal" range, it might need a boost to get you to the level your body requires.

Everything that I read said that my levels wouldn't return to normal for six months since I have been so low for the past 7 years. I'm still tired and I'm hoping that if I double the dose by taking one at night and one in the morning, I will be good to go. My stomach has had no issues and my stomach is so sensitive that I can't even take ibuprofen. I still take it with food, but it can be minimal for which is great. I would highly recommend this product. I'm so grateful that I got the recommendation and thrilled that it is really working and I can feeling the effects.

body: Not sure how much this helped raise my iron levels.  After two weeks of taking it I was still too low to donate blood, which was the whole purpose of my purchasing it in the first place. title: Good for a lot of people, just not me.
body: After all the reading I did before getting this I was all set to be thrilled with finally "coming back to life" from anemia because I was sleeping up to 20 hours a day & wishing I could sleep all 24 not to mention weak as a kitten.  I took it exactly as specified & got mild relief of the symptoms... I was sleeping about 12 to 15 hours a day but able to stay awake the other hours and function.  But the downside was that this stuff was harsh on my stomach with iron taste and smell and burps & reflux from hell no matter what I did.  I was ready to just tough it out and keep going until my hubby got me some cheap generic type 65mg Ferrous Sulfate & I took it with OJ, Ester-C tablets & sublingual B12 all at the same time on an empty stomach.  That did the trick for me.  I'm sure everyone is different.  I think this is a good product especially for those who are experiencing mild to moderate iron absorption problems or lacking iron in the diet.  I totally agree 100% with it's statements about vitamin C and B being the key to iron absorption, but it also takes enzymes for that important reaction to take place so look into the whole process of how iron is taken up into the body.  That will help you sort out where you're going wrong or where you have digestive damage that won't allow uptake properly so you have to work hard at getting it in you.  I'd still recommend this for most people... just not those of us with long term digestive diseases that give us severe anemia issues.  I suggest taking it with a big meal though because those iron flavored acidic reflux burps are nauseating if you took it on an empty stomach.  You'll not like the smell of them if that happens and won't want to take them again.

title: raised my hemoglobin levels from 5 to 7.5 in less than two weeks
body: I don't normally do reviews but I got a tremendous amount of help from everyone who posted theirs so here goes...I went in for a sore throat.  Had it for three weeks, took two z-packs -still had it.  Went back in, got a steroid shot and an antibiotic shot  and requested for once in my life- blood work.  (needle phobia)  So, the next day my blood test comes back and I have severe anemia and need a transfusion.  But,  I feel better and emphatically do not want to have a transfusion.  I'm told to take an iron supplement for a month and then have more blood tests.  At this time, I am experiencing rapid heart rate which I attributed to anxiety from stress, sore throat, which was probably the glossitis from anemia, rabid ice eating (which I've done for years) a crack in the corner of my lip which I thought was just dehydration, low energy levels, lack of mental clarity which I attributed to regular fatigue, breakthrough bleeding and thinning hair.  So, I had a lot of symptoms. I think I've had severe anemia for many years but my body adjusted itself until it couldn't anymore.  About the only thing left was for me to get dizzy enough to faint.  I started two hours later on the otc iron by spring valley from wal-mart.- ferrous sulfate.  That night researched and found out about taking the pills on empty stomach with orange juice or vitamin c to increase acidity which increases absorption.  No eating two hours before or after.  No milk, no caffeine, all the myriad things that block iron absorption.  I ordered this product and didn't get it for a few days but added it to my schedule immediately.  I really didn't want a transfusion! .  Took two of these and two of the spring valley, spread out through the day.  Had to wake up in the middle of the night to do this.  Trying to wrap this up, not sure which worked?  I also ate only beef twice a day with orange juice or tomatoes for citrus. I never ate that much red meat in my life, btw, and also btw last year I lost 30 lbs. eating mostly fruit smoothies and nuts. Also, my b-12 levels about half of the normal level. My mother has anemia also (who knew?) and I think my condition is hereditary and dietary. The point is...all the reviews I could find said three weeks to increase your hemoglobin levels.  I did 2.5 points it in 10 days. (I know you can overdose on iron) My LPN's supervisor, a general practioner contacted me and insisted I come in.  Said he would give me two weeks to have more bloodwork done. But when he discussed my case with whomever, they all said  blood transfusion immediately.  I compromised and got the one week grace period.  By then I had been on iron 3 days or so. I now own just about every iron supplement available and will update as I find out more.  Just so you know, there is a supplement called Proferrin ES (got it on Amazon for $50.)that is based on heme(meat-based) iron that I just received and will be trying. And I'm taking B12 sublingually and getting a B-12 shot. I spent a lot of money on these supplements and it was freaking worth it to me to not have a transfusion.  Guess I'll be getting regular blood work now, great.  Once I'm out of dangerous levels, will experiment with what works best.  Now, daily I'm taking one Blood Builder with food, one proferrin ES with o.j.,and one ferrous sulfate with o.j.  Also adding ferrous fumarate from a prescription- swapping out every other day with the ferrous sulfate.  Still need to double my iron levels, and they took a lot of my precious new blood for the blood test! I mean really.  I'm getting tests done because of my blood problem! That was the closest I felt to dizzy through the whole ordeal.  Already staying up til 10:30 at night now, used to go to bed at 8PM. Concerned having anemia so long may have done permanent damage to my heart though. Doctor said not to exercise until I get my levels up, I could have cardiac arrest.***Update*** Doctor called with 3rd blood test results, taken May 21st. (First was done on April 25th.) Hemoglobin count at 11. Ran two miles and played softball this week.  Huge difference. First bill came in, from hospital lab for blood work.  Insurance paid $8 of a $250 bill. wow! That stings.  Apparently I haven't met my "deductible."  I've had three of these blood test now, so I'm wondering what the other two bills will be.  Good thing I have such awesome BCBS insurance from my employer. Who can afford to get sick?

title: I love this product
body: Since my first pregnancy, I have had problems with anemia for most of my adult life.  When I was younger iron supplements caused me no problems, but since I've gotten older they wreak havoc on my stomach.  And now that I am going through pre-menopausal symptoms with severe blood loss, I am not able to do without taking iron supplements.  I had gotten to the point of collapse from the slow process of iron reduction in my blood from my monthly cycles.  At which point, I got on line and searched for an iron product that would not tear my stomach apart.  I came across MegaFood Blood Builder which is produced from beet root.  The information that I read indicated that it was gentle on the stomach.  So, I gave it a shot, thinking that I would suffer, at least, a little bit of stomach discomfort, and I ordered it.  I was surprised when I began taking the pills and did not feel any adverse reactions in my stomach, but thought that after it builds up in my gut, I would begin to feel pain; but that never happened.  I have been taking this product for nearly a year and a half.  Because of the severity of my anemia I take more than the recommended dosage, according to the level of fatigue and blood loss I am experiencing at the time; and have never felt any inkling of stomach irritation.  I believe this product has saved me from becoming hospitalized and having to undergo the surgical alteration/removal of my female organ.  With the help of this product I have been able to undergo the natural process of feminine maturity without having to succumb to the mutilation of my womb.  For that, I am extremely grateful for this product; it is a God-send!

title: So Much Better Than Iron
body: I had total knee replacement surgery in February and was very anemic.  My doctor prescribed iron pills, but I could not tolerate them - all kinds of digestive upsets - so I stopped them, but was constantly run down and extremely tired.  I mentioned the problem to my PT and she said "I can help you".  She recommended Blood Builder and I bought a bottle.  I cannot recommend this highly enough - my last blood work showed iron levels of 13.8 - after being down to 7 on discharge from rehab.  The best part is absolutely no side effects and I have the energy to enjoy my new knee.  I'm having my other knee done in December and I've already told my surgeon no way I'm taking iron - just Blood Builder for me.

title: Good for a lot of people, just not me.
body: After all the reading I did before getting this I was all set to be thrilled with finally "coming back to life" from anemia because I was sleeping up to 20 hours a day & wishing I could sleep all 24 not to mention weak as a kitten.  I took it exactly as specified & got mild relief of the symptoms... I was sleeping about 12 to 15 hours a day but able to stay awake the other hours and function.  But the downside was that this stuff was harsh on my stomach with iron taste and smell and burps & reflux from hell no matter what I did.  I was ready to just tough it out and keep going until my hubby got me some cheap generic type 65mg Ferrous Sulfate & I took it with OJ, Ester-C tablets & sublingual B12 all at the same time on an empty stomach.  That did the trick for me.  I'm sure everyone is different.  I think this is a good product especially for those who are experiencing mild to moderate iron absorption problems or lacking iron in the diet.  I totally agree 100% with it's statements about vitamin C and B being the key to iron absorption, but it also takes enzymes for that important reaction to take place so look into the whole process of how iron is taken up into the body.  That will help you sort out where you're going wrong or where you have digestive damage that won't allow uptake properly so you have to work hard at getting it in you.  I'd still recommend this for most people... just not those of us with long term digestive diseases that give us severe anemia issues.  I suggest taking it with a big meal though because those iron flavored acidic reflux burps are nauseating if you took it on an empty stomach.  You'll not like the smell of them if that happens and won't want to take them again.

title: Cautiously optimistic

This past spring, I was also diagnosed with low platelets, which Google tells me is quite alarming.  I started taking a One a Day Women's vitamin, and noticed hardly any change.  However, after adding Blood Builders in addition to the One a Day, my number are finalllly starting to come back up.  Even my platelet numbers are improving, which the doctor does not think is related to the iron deficiency, but I am now suspecting the platelet boost is due to the B12 in Blood Builders.  My hematologist was prepared to set me up for iron injections and was somewhat dumbfounded that my numbers were actually improving with just a supplement.

title: I really believe this is some kind of miracle supplement.
body: I have/had severe anemia requiring blood transfusions.  Last year, in the course of 6 months, I had 6 blood transfusions (2 bags of blood each transfusion).  I was looking on Amazon for a book on anemia and on the side where they have suggestions listed I saw this and it made me curious.  When I read the reviews, they were so great, I just had to try it, as my anemia was not getting better following my hematologist's suggestions/orders.  After only one month, taking one a day, it raised my hemoglobin up to 13.0 - the highest it has ever been (it's funny because I read a review and the reviewer said it brought their hemoglobin up to 13 as well).  I couldn't believe it.  It did not only normalize my hemoglobin levels, but after a couple more months, all my blood levels were perfect.  Even my new hematologist told me that he wished his blood levels were as good as mine!  I think this is really like some miracle supplement!  The best part about it is that is from all whole foods.  My first hematologist had me take these iron supplements (ferrous sulfate) that actually messed up my digestive system and made me severely ill (I think they caused gastro-intestinal bleeding), which is why I kept needing blood transfusions.  I would definitely recommend these to anyone having any kind of blood issues.  Another hematologist told me straight out that these supplements wouldn't help me because they don't contain enough iron to bring my levels up, but he was wrong!  It has totally made me see that doctors don't know it all, even the specialists.  If you have anemia, just get this - it can change your life.

title: raised my hemoglobin levels from 5 to 7.5 in less than two weeks
body: I don't normally do reviews but I got a tremendous amount of help from everyone who posted theirs so here goes...I went in for a sore throat.  Had it for three weeks, took two z-packs -still had it.  Went back in, got a steroid shot and an antibiotic shot  and requested for once in my life- blood work.  (needle phobia)  So, the next day my blood test comes back and I have severe anemia and need a transfusion.  But,  I feel better and emphatically do not want to have a transfusion.  I'm told to take an iron supplement for a month and then have more blood tests.  At this time, I am experiencing rapid heart rate which I attributed to anxiety from stress, sore throat, which was probably the glossitis from anemia, rabid ice eating (which I've done for years) a crack in the corner of my lip which I thought was just dehydration, low energy levels, lack of mental clarity which I attributed to regular fatigue, breakthrough bleeding and thinning hair.  So, I had a lot of symptoms. I think I've had severe anemia for many years but my body adjusted itself until it couldn't anymore.  About the only thing left was for me to get dizzy enough to faint.  I started two hours later on the otc iron by spring valley from wal-mart.- ferrous sulfate.  That night researched and found out about taking the pills on empty stomach with orange juice or vitamin c to increase acidity which increases absorption.  No eating two hours before or after.  No milk, no caffeine, all the myriad things that block iron absorption.  I ordered this product and didn't get it for a few days but added it to my schedule immediately.  I really didn't want a transfusion! .  Took two of these and two of the spring valley, spread out through the day.  Had to wake up in the middle of the night to do this.  Trying to wrap this up, not sure which worked?  I also ate only beef twice a day with orange juice or tomatoes for citrus. I never ate that much red meat in my life, btw, and also btw last year I lost 30 lbs. eating mostly fruit smoothies and nuts. Also, my b-12 levels about half of the normal level. My mother has anemia also (who knew?) and I think my condition is hereditary and dietary. The point is...all the reviews I could find said three weeks to increase your hemoglobin levels.  I did 2.5 points it in 10 days. (I know you can overdose on iron) My LPN's supervisor, a general practioner contacted me and insisted I come in.  Said he would give me two weeks to have more bloodwork done. But when he discussed my case with whomever, they all said  blood transfusion immediately.  I compromised and got the one week grace period.  By then I had been on iron 3 days or so. I now own just about every iron supplement available and will update as I find out more.  Just so you know, there is a supplement called Proferrin ES (got it on Amazon for $50.)that is based on heme(meat-based) iron that I just received and will be trying. And I'm taking B12 sublingually and getting a B-12 shot. I spent a lot of money on these supplements and it was freaking worth it to me to not have a transfusion.  Guess I'll be getting regular blood work now, great.  Once I'm out of dangerous levels, will experiment with what works best.  Now, daily I'm taking one Blood Builder with food, one proferrin ES with o.j.,and one ferrous sulfate with o.j.  Also adding ferrous fumarate from a prescription- swapping out every other day with the ferrous sulfate.  Still need to double my iron levels, and they took a lot of my precious new blood for the blood test! I mean really.  I'm getting tests done because of my blood problem! That was the closest I felt to dizzy through the whole ordeal.  Already staying up til 10:30 at night now, used to go to bed at 8PM. Concerned having anemia so long may have done permanent damage to my heart though. Doctor said not to exercise until I get my levels up, I could have cardiac arrest.***Update*** Doctor called with 3rd blood test results, taken May 21st. (First was done on April 25th.) Hemoglobin count at 11. Ran two miles and played softball this week.  Huge difference. First bill came in, from hospital lab for blood work.  Insurance paid $8 of a $250 bill. wow! That stings.  Apparently I haven't met my "deductible."  I've had three of these blood test now, so I'm wondering what the other two bills will be.  Good thing I have such awesome BCBS insurance from my employer. Who can afford to get sick?

title: Most Effective Iron Supplement

I would get winded climbing stairs, would sleep for days and had no energy to speak of. I tried every kind of iron supplement - pills and liquids. While they may have helped bring my levels up slightly, they wreaked havoc on my GI tract. I was so swollen that a co-worker asked if I was pregnant. A friend recommended Blood Builder back in March and I haven't stopped taking them since. I have the quite possibly the most sensitive stomach around and these cause me no issues. It still took me a while to get my energy back but they put me back at 100% without any of the nasty side effects. I continue to take this every evening to ensure I hit my daily iron levels.

The only way I can take them is with a flavored drink which even then I have to keep sipping for about 10 seconds after I've swallowed the pill to keep the taste from coming back. I wish they were coating or something.  Also, because there is no coating the outside becomes soft very fast.  This has caused the pill to stick to the back of my throat 3x now and refuse to go down, once to the point of gagging until I threw it back up.  I know I sound dramatic but I take about 7 or 8 pills (all vitamins) every morning for years and never had any issues until these.  I'm sure they are great but the taste is just unavoidable and horrible! body: While BloodBuilder does seem to result in fewer side effects, I still notice some mild nausea about 1-2 hours after taking it (usually with lunch). It only lasts an hour or so, but I would be hesitant to say it has NO side affects. Still totally worth it.

title: Not a miracle pill.
body: This product was strongly recommended to me by a health foods employee. He said it was their top seller, and after reading all the positive reviews, I decided to give it a try. I've had bad experiences with various iron supplements in the past (constipation), and so was nervous to try another one. Luckily, I experienced no side effects from this product, which is why I gave it 2 stars instead of 1. However, after 2 months of taking it (1 daily for first month, 2 daily for second month) and eating lots of iron-rich food, my iron levels actually LOWERED. So, this form of iron may work for some, but not for everyone.

title: Great for people sensitive to other iron pills
body: I'm pregnant and was told that my iron was low.  I tried traditional iron pills (ferrous sulfate) and even if I ate food with them I would feel very sick to my stomach or even throw-up.  These pills are food-based and much easier to absorb.  I can take them without any other food and still feel just fine.  From what I understand they also absorb much better being food-based as well.  These have been great for me!

title: Iron up 56 points in 5 weeks
body: I had been taking a liquid herbal iron (Floradix) for 90 days, and my total iron was 33 and my ferritin was 24.  I switched to Solgar iron bisglycinate and my total iron is now 89 and my Ferritin is 38.  Iron saturation went from 11 on Floradix to 25 on Solgar iron.  I am a believer.  It seems like it wouldn't do anything because it is such a small milligram dose, but it works beautifully, small capsule, 1x per day.  I am amazed and will never use anything else.

title: If you need to supplement iron, this is the best form
body: If you have iron deficiency anemia, iron supplementation is the only way to deal with it. There are different forms of iron, though, and some tend to cause worse side effects than others. In general iron tends to cause stomach discomfort and constipation, but this form of iron, iron bisglycinate, is a chelated form that from what I've seen has fewer to no side effects.

title: HONEST 5 STAR REVIEW
body: This product really helped raise my Ferritin levels without the common complications people taking an iron supplement suffer from.  Does what it says. Five stars!

body: VERY happy - no constipation with 50mg each night taken with Vit C drink. No nausea even on empty stomach. When I first started this I thought it caused me constipation but it was due to another issue. I restarted this after 2 weeks and it has been no problem ever since (6 weeks now).

title: VERY pleased with this product!

title: Easy on stomach but not as potent as I needed.
body: This does the job as an iron that is gentle on the stomach, but I didn't get the same results as I had with a Wellesse liquid iron I also purchased from Amazon. I have trouble with low ferritin causing hair loss. When switching from the liquid to this (3-4 pills per day) it seemed as though my hair loss increased again. Adding back in the liquid and using 1-2 of these in addition works fine without additional stomach issues. I'm just using until they are gone and likely won't replace. However, if your sole purpose is easy on the stomach iron, this is a good choice.

title: Excellent, highly recommended.  read me! I am not a doctor!

I have deficiency, formerly anemia (have been supplementing for 5 weeks with ferrous sufate, which constipated me so bad I had large hard black painful stools, stomach cramps and indigestion and I had to immediately stop when I literally ripped my anus from taking 3 tablets a day of ferrous sulfate. TMI ;)

title: Not As Effective as Slow FE
body: I've suffered from anemia for years, and have monthly blood tests to check my iron levels.  Someone mentioned to me that chelated iron wouldn't cause the side effects of constipation caused by other types of iron, so I bought this to try it.  I appreciated the fact that this iron comes in a brown glass bottle, which seems to me to be better protection for the supplements than a plastic bottle.  I also noted happily that these supplements are made in USA.  However, my blood tests were not as good after a month using this supplement as while using Slow FE.  When I quizzed my doctor as to why, he explained that this iron supplement, as well as other chelated iron supplements, are made using plant based iron, which is not as readily absorbed by the body.  It would probably be fine for someone whose condition is not as severe as mine, but it just didn't work for me.  Bummer.  I'll pass the remainder of this bottle along to my daughter.

title: So far, so good!  no tummy ache.
body: I was excited to try this product since the other two types of iron supplements that I've tried gave me a tummy ache, and also made me feel so dizzy and weird that I didn't want to take them a second day. Two doctors have recently diagnosed me with significant anemia (from heavy  periods ,fibroids, and a mostly vegetarian diet for the last decade or two). This was recommended by a friend and I have to say that one capsule in I feel totally fine!  I've read other reviews here and it seems that some women take up to seven of these a day!  I'm hoping my blood tests show that a smaller dose is adequate  for me as I'm also trying to incorporate iron rich foods including meat into my diet as well. I've recently hit menopause too but was still encouraged to get my levels up with a supplement for at least a year or two. Hopefully this is the ticket since iron is so hard to tolerate for me usually.

title: Best quality, very gentle
body: This has been my tried and true iron supplement since 2012, it far surpasses other brands in quality and gentleness.

title: Stopped my hairloss
body: In the throws of periomenopause, I found I was losing a disproportionate amount of hair. Tests confirmed ferritin level below 10. I've been taking Solgar for 6 weeks and my hairloss is almost nonexistant. I won't have blood drawn for a few more months but can't wait to see a higher number. Tip; take your iron supplement with small glass of juice containing vitamin c for better absorption. 5 months on Solgar and my hair regrowth is nothing short of amazing! My stylist couldn't believe it!

title: Trouble
body: I broke out in a rash from it.  The Mayo Clinic lists iron supplements as a cause for a rash. It is a common reaction.  It took a very long time to heal and my dermatologist did a biopsy.  I was put on it by a neurologist for restless leg syndrome. The allergist who also saw it said it was bruised skin.  Quite a mess.

title: I highly recommend, but please read...
body: I'm seriously impressed with Solgar's Gentle Iron, but I got off to a shaky start. The first time I took it (2 capsules on the 1st try), I became dizzy and queasy and felt really unwell. I contacted my doctor about the symptoms and ended up being seen to rule out an allergic response. I was told to wait a week and then try just one capsule and watch my response, and I'm really glad I followed that advice because it's turned out to be an amazing iron supplement.

body: Bought after reading lots of reviews. Seemed to be helping a lot of others in the same sleep deprived state I am in. While it hasn't completely changed my life as some others said, it has helped & that's a blessing cuz being tired all the time sucks!

title: Oh, the trials of supplementing iron...
body: My body did not tolerate this product. I thought all my symptoms were coming back in a hurry and it turned out this supplement was the cause. No fault of Solgar. They appear to a be a top notch company answering my questions when I called to inquire about this item. Would I recommend it to others? If you need to go the supplemental route and the usual iron is not tolerated, this may work. That said, if you have digestive issues going on, it may be easiest to have a doctor setup iron infusions. It is a few hours once a week and unlike iron supplements, the infusions do not pass through the digestive tract.

title: Raised my numbers up and is easy on the stomach!
body: I started this iron from Solgar a year ago.  I was having stomach issues with other forms of iron, and my numbers were stagnant.  I am pleased to report that my Ferritin has increased slowly over the last year. I was born iron deficient and anemic.  My Ferritin stayed around 17-19 and I was sent to try infusions.  I wanted to avoid those.  A year later my Ferritin is now a 76!! I've never had it that high in my whole life.  The only thing I changed was taking the Solgar Iron.  I get an aftertaste sometimes if I don't take this with Vit. C, but it is tolerable.

title: Liquid Iron is better.

Also you want to avoid taking it with calcium and things that contain tannins like tea. It seems to be working too since I have more energy but my doctor said it takes at least a month or two for your blood iron levels to actually increase so I am going to take this for 2 months then get my iron levels tested again.  I also like that the capsules are vegetarian and are free of common allergens like wheat and dairy.

title: NOT Corn Free
body: This product is NOT corn free. It is advertised as being corn free here and so I purchased some; I felt the need for some additional iron and I'm allergic to corn so it seemed like a perfect fit. When I received the product, imagine my surprise when I received the product and while the bottle listed many things in the ... this doesn't contain that... part of the bottle, corn was not listed as one of the items that the product lacked. So I contacted Solgar who were quite responsive. I was informed that not only did the product contain corn but that the actual iron itself were derived from corn. I did not return the product or ask for a refund but gave it to my husband and son who both regularly donate blood. Solgar is a great company with quality vitamins so this review does not reflect the company but does reflect the inaccurate advertising of this product on Amazon. In the meantime I am still in search of corn free iron.

title: Helps with pain
body: These have been very helpful for me. Although I don't recall my bloodwork coming back as low iron or anemic, I have suffered many years with debilitating onsets of pain throughout the lower half of my body. This pain felt like it was set deep in my bones, through my lower back, hips, legs and feet. Where no amount of Motrin would help and I was bed ridden during these onsets of unbearable pain. It wasn't just isolated to the joints, it radiated throughout my legs, as if they were being crushed. I finally found a decent doctor who suggested to take a little extra iron when this happens. I don't know how this could be mind over matter given the incredible pain, but the next time I did experience the pain, I took 3 or 4 of these iron pills and within an hour or two, the pain had greatly diminished. I've experienced these onsets of pain several times after being given this advice, and each time theses iron supplements have helped. Still no clue as to why this happens but very grateful I found something that helps.

I have been taking this now for nearly a week with no side effects whatsoever!  I just upped the amount to two pills a day and am still doing just fine.  I realize it's not the 325mg that I am supposed to be taking, but something is better than nothing.  I can't say anything about energy level since I haven't been on it long enough to tell, but if you have issues with other iron products I would definitely recommend that you give this one a try! title: Definitely a gentle form of iron! Very pleased!
body: I purchased solgar gentle iron 25 mg supplement because I needed an iron supplement that would be gentle on my stomach. I have taken various iron supplements and always end up with horrible abdominal pain and cramping. This gentle iron is very different from other supplements I've taken. It is not a hard, compact, pill. It is like a standard vegetarian capsule where it is a greenish powder contained in a single capsule. The dosage states only one capsule is needed (which is great because I hate taking pills!). It is a good size and super easy to swallow. I take this in the evening around an hour before bedtime. I have read it is better to take iron supplements after all of your meals are complete. Overall I am pleased with this product. I have had no upset tummy or constipation side effects from taking this. I am still waiting to see how the supplement impacts my overall RLS symptoms since I've only been taking a week. My symptoms do seem better, but it is early to make a verdict. I think this is a great method of supplementing your iron intake without all of the pain and suffering associated with traditional iron supplements

title: Gentle indeed, at least to me
body: I have been taking this daily for the past 3 months, prophylactically, because I'm pregnant. It hasn't given me any noticeable side effects. I took prenatal multivitamins that contain iron for a while, but those made my stomach hurt, so I switched to non-iron vitamins and started taking this iron supplement separately instead. My stomach pain went away. I've had no constipation, headaches, nausea or other symptoms from it at all. The capsules are regular size, so not very small, but not huge either (my omega-3 supplement gel caps are much bigger!). So during early pregnancy when I was most nauseous, it took some work to get it down, but it wasn't too terribly bad. Now that the nausea is over, it goes down very easily. I don't get my blood checked often enough to know if it made a difference in my hemoglobin levels, but I read that this is the recommended supplemental daily amount for pregnant women, and I haven't had any problems so far, so I'm guessing it's enough.

title: High quality and gentle on the stomach

They have been using this for several months, and neither have had any stomach distress at all. In addition, having done quite a bit of examination on the quality of vitamin and mineral supplements in general, I have found that this company is unfailingly rated highly. They do not use questionable sources (e.g. Chinese suppliers) for manufacturing their products, and all reviews note very good quality control. Solgar are a bit more expensive, but considering how many others we bought and had to dispose of due to stomach upset, they are excellent value for money. We also use their multi-vitamin supplements, and other mineral supplements they produce.

title: High quality and gentle on the stomach
body: Used by two in my family, my wife and daughter, both of whom need iron supplements. They have had problems with stomach upset from all other iron supplements, including slow-release forms. They have been using this for several months, and neither have had any stomach distress at all. In addition, having done quite a bit of examination on the quality of vitamin and mineral supplements in general, I have found that this company is unfailingly rated highly. They do not use questionable sources (e.g. Chinese suppliers) for manufacturing their products, and all reviews note very good quality control. Solgar are a bit more expensive, but considering how many others we bought and had to dispose of due to stomach upset, they are excellent value for money. We also use their multi-vitamin supplements, and other mineral supplements they produce.

title: Amazing!
body: I was prescribed iron 5 years ago and have tried most all prescription and nonprescription iron tablets/capsules.  I am so sensitive that even one pill will disrupt my GI system for 3-4 days!  I refused to take the IV iron because of the side effects so I've basically been on my own trying to find an iron supplement that I could take.  Enter Solgar ""gentle" iron.  I have been taking this now for nearly a week with no side effects whatsoever!  I just upped the amount to two pills a day and am still doing just fine.  I realize it's not the 325mg that I am supposed to be taking, but something is better than nothing.  I can't say anything about energy level since I haven't been on it long enough to tell, but if you have issues with other iron products I would definitely recommend that you give this one a try!  I am thrilled that I finally found something I can take!

title: If only I could give ten stars...
body: In November of 2014, I finally stopped cursing my very existence and pretty much demanded a dermatology consult for the increasing hair loss and  painful scalp after over a year of continuous weakness and breakage.  She checked my ferritin.  It was 8.3.  Once I looked up what ferritin was, I was Shocked and, then, even more aware of my foot pain, lack of energy, shortness of breath over moderate distances and non-obese leg weakness going up one Flight of stairs!  I immediately jumped on Amazon to look up iron supplements - the One supplement that I wasn't taking in an effort to regrow my hair.  Understanding How I became so devastatingly iron deficient, I guess I'll never will.  What I Do know is that Vitron C has saved me from even more devastating effects to come.  Taking two pills a day, after learning how to take iron appropriately, my ferritin went up to 18.2 within a month.  In four months, 33.3.  Got it checked yesterday out of mourning for the slow, inconsistent hair regrowth: It's up to 118.8.  All the pain and weakness, I should say, is long gone.  I sit here shocked and amazed and eternally grateful for Vitron C's overwhelming ability to single-handedly return me to health!  All benefit with no bowel side effects for me in the least.  I'll be taking them until they stop making them or unless my levels start to top out.  These have got to be the best iron supplements, WITH the vitamin C, on the market today.

title: Decent Iron Pill
body: When I was diagnosed as iron deficient, my doctor recommended these iron pills. I have been taking them for a few weeks now. With the high amount of iron, I expected every side-effect and then some. There have been some side-effects, but none have been too dramatic.

title: Effective and Doesn't Have a Bad Taste!
body: My doctor recommended VItron-C specifically when I found out I had iron-deficient anemia because it's one of the few iron supplements out there that also contains the vitamin C the body needs to absorb the iron, just like the body needs vitamin D to absorb calcium.  My doctor said a lot of people out there take any old over the counter iron supplement, thinking they're getting the iron they need, when really their body isn't absorbing very much of it because they aren't also taking the vitamin C necessary.

title: Helped Me Quickly
body: Vitron-C was recommended by a surgeon as I was seriously anemic. He said he always recommended this brand because patients seemed to tolerate it better than other formulations and that it seemed to help quickly. He had me start by taking two pills daily and within 40 days, I went from a scary level of anemia to borderline average readings on bloodwork. I cut down to one pill daily and after another six months, my iron levels were right in the middle of normal. My doctor told me I would have to stay on this for the rest of my life. It's a small price to pay to not have the extreme fatigue and other issues I experienced while anemic. A bonus is that, unlike other iron supplements, Vitron-C doesn't leave a metallic taste in my mouth and it doesn't cause constipation.

title: Cannot tolerate gross side effect
body: Shortly after taking this product, I had extremely disgusting tasting burps to follow - like the kind that make you want to throw up.  Perhaps this doesn't happen to everyone..  It is great to have a product with vitamin C to help absorb the iron, but it just isn't for me.

title: Helped me, my doc approves
body: Taking this product has helped me get my blood iron levels on track. It's gone from very anemic to borderline, almost normal. I waited a long time to get the lab test done, so can't say how long it took to improve. Also, I started eating red meat once a week.

title: Effective and Convenient Iron+C Combination
body: Very effective.  One tablet per day over three months raised my ferritin level from 35 to 180.

title: For me, symptom-free iron pills
body: This was recommended to me by my doctor, since I'm always hovering around anemia. She said a lot of iron pills make you constipated, but because of the vitamin C in Vitron C, it a) causes you to absorb more of the iron and b) alleviates the typical constipation people feel when taking iron pills. This has been true for me. I've been taking these for over a year now and I feel great (when my iron is low, I can tell because my running suffers) and have no constipation (or other) issues. I would recommend this if you need to take iron.

title: Works, but tough to stomach
body: Doctor recommended this supplement as Iron apparently is absorbed much better with vitamin C. Still I struggled to stay on it consistently because of the awful indigestion and nasty burps it caused.  I tried taking it with and without food and at all different times of the day, but never found something that worked for me.

title: Works really well, and it's easy on the stomach.

She's feeling much better these days. I used to take them years ago bc regular iron caused constipation. These did not. Coupled with a really good B vitamin (like Garden of Life or Pure Encapsulations) and digestive enzymes, my Pernicious Anemia has been resolved.

title: Effective, but not without side effects
body: I am pregnant, and my blood test showed some signs of anemia. I had somewhat low levels of hemoglobin and hematocrit, though they were pretty normal for pregnancy. After my doctor tested my ferritin (which measures your iron stores), which was only 12, I was convinced that some iron supplements might help my energy levels in the long term. After two months of taking these almost daily, my ferritin rose to 39 from 12. My hemoglobin and hematocrit levels only rose a small amount. I can't say my energy levels have improved, but I'm now very pregnant and it would take a miracle to improve my energy levels. Overall, I am satisfied with the results of this supplement.

My husband was the one who suggested that I might have an iron deficiency which made sense to me.  I hopped on Amazon, found this product, and the rest is history.  I experienced almost an immediate turnaround in my energy after taking this supplement.  On day 1 the haze I had been walking around with almost disappeared, by day 2 the haze and all-day headache were gone, and by day 3 I felt completely like my old self again with restored energy levels.  I also love that there is not a huge list of fillers in this product.  This Iron complex will be a keeper for me!!

title: Best iron pill for your money. B12 and folate are an added plus!
body: Best iron pill you can buy and much cheaper than other 'blood builders". The chellated form is the easiest supplemental form you can absorb (it is second only to heme-iron, found in meats). The Vitamin C increases your intestine's absorption of iron. The b12 and folate prevent another type of anemia that IS common, but not related to iron deficiency. So this will prevent iron deficiency anemia and megaloblastic anemia (caused by B12 and/or folate deficiency). The L-Histidine is an essential amino acid (meaning our bodies cannot make it on its own, we have to get it from an outside source) that is also part of the same process of folate and b12. I've never heard of anyone being deficient in that, but at least you know you won't be deficient!

title: Does What Says
body: I get anemic sometimes and my doctor puts me on iron - the ferrous gluconate form, however there's a problem with it; I have a permanently partially obstructed intestine and ferrous gluconate causes severe constipation which is a life-threatening problem for me.  I have to take another medication that counteracts the ferrous gluconate, and it's expensive as well as having to take it every night without fail.  Sometimes I do forget and the results are severe.  I switched over to Zahler's because even though it's not ferrous gluconate, I feel as well when I'm on it as I do when taking the ferrous gluconate form of iron.  The advantage to it is that it not only doesn't cause constipation, it helps me to remain regular without taking the extra medication to keep my intestines working, and not end up in the hospital with a nasogastric tube in me, or worse, surgery.  I highly recommend this product because it does what it says it will do, and it doesn't have the constipating side effects that most iron supplements have.  It may not be something that you'd give as a gift to someone, but it sure is a gift to me.

body: Love this purchase. I was recently diagnosed as being anemic and had no clue where to start. Initially I thought I could get the additional iron via fruits and vegetables. I initially opposed taking supplements as everything I saw online about which supplement, when and with what was a bit overwhelming. But it came down to having to take them. A coworker actually recommended this one as her high school age daughter takes these. Glad I took her advice as so far so good. I personally have had no stomach issues with these. I take these immediately upon waking up on an empty stomach with a good amount of water. I give this one full hour before I eat breakfast and take my daily multivitamin. Taking this supplement with tons of water helps to curb my appetite for an hour long enough to let the iron absorb before eating.

title: As advertised, no problems
body: This seems to be a good product because they make the iron more bioavailable by adding vitamin C. It never gave me any cramps or constipation like folks say with certain supplements, but this is the only iron supplement I have every used. Just remember that iron toxicity is also bad and perhaps worse than a defficiency. I used maybe half this bottle before I felt like I no longer needed it. Chlorella is also high in iron and can be mixed with lemon juice and water for easy absorption in the morning. Just remember that calcium creates some interference with iron absorption. I don't know hoe much that really matters, because if you look at a food like kale, it contains iron, calcium and vitamin C among other things. The interference is there but it may not be too big of a deal unless you are really anemic or lost blood for any reason. Please make an informed decision though, I am no MD.

title: As advertised, no problems
body: This seems to be a good product because they make the iron more bioavailable by adding vitamin C. It never gave me any cramps or constipation like folks say with certain supplements, but this is the only iron supplement I have every used. Just remember that iron toxicity is also bad and perhaps worse than a defficiency. I used maybe half this bottle before I felt like I no longer needed it. Chlorella is also high in iron and can be mixed with lemon juice and water for easy absorption in the morning. Just remember that calcium creates some interference with iron absorption. I don't know hoe much that really matters, because if you look at a food like kale, it contains iron, calcium and vitamin C among other things. The interference is there but it may not be too big of a deal unless you are really anemic or lost blood for any reason. Please make an informed decision though, I am no MD.

title: Excellent Supplement, No negative side effects for me!
body: I signed up to donate blood, and they test you for iron deficiency (anemia) before they take your donation. Well, i was surprised that I had iron deficient blood and was unable to donate. The nurse told me that I should take a regular supplement and recommended Zahlers. Well i have been taking this for about 3 months now and I can feel an improvement in my overall health and I got my blood tested and my iron is back within norrnal range now. Anemia is actually very common among women of child bearing age. I addition to taking this supplement I also tried to increase my intake of iron rich foods such as breakfast cereals enriched with iron, cooked beans, tofu, pumpkin, sesame, or squash seeds..the list goes on you can do an internet search for iron rich foods. Many of these are foods that I would not normally pick uo at the store but it is fun finding ways to incorporate them into my diet now. Anyway, I am about to purchase my 3rd bottle and would recommend this supplement to anyone. There were no negative side effects for me.

title: Beyond Pleased!
body: I ABSOLUTELY LOVE this new Iron supplement!!! My iron stores are FINALLY high enough to get back on a regular iron supplement and this product delivers exactly what it promises!  I have loved taking it, it's gentle on my stomach & I never even feel it when I take it (no upset stomach or anything) and Zero Constipation! I am a happy camper with this new supplement! title: My favorite iron supplement
body: I've struggled with iron deficiency anemia for most of my life and have been on iron supplements a lot. I found these recently and could not be happier with them! They don't upset my stomach or making me nauseous or constipated like most have in the past. And my lab work is steadily improving on them. I will say that they still make me tend toward constipation, but as long as I'm conscious to drink enough water throughout the day I have no problems, which is a marked improvement over other iron supplements I've taken in the past that just caused constipation no matter what I did.

title: Good Pre- and Post-Natal Iron Supplement
body: I was diagnosed with anemia in my third trimester of pregnancy.  I loved my Rainbow Light prenatals, and so I looked to RL for an iron supplement.  Within four weeks of taking this product, my iron levels were back to normal.  Of course, after I delivered, they were worse than ever.  RL to the rescue again!

title: " which are exquisitely sensitive and painful oral ulcers since I was a child
body: I've dealt with "mouth ulcers," which in my family we also called "fever blisters," which are exquisitely sensitive and painful oral ulcers since I was a child. Some believe they are caused by a virus (but not related to the herpes viruses--I know--I have oral herpes and the two are quite different), and there does seem to be a genetic component in that many people with these sores state other family members also have them (NHS data). I've tried many things to deal with this issue, including lysine (a careful six-month trial with no change) and various OTC salves, rinses, and mouthwashes, including saline. Nothing seems to change the frequency of the "attacks," and the OTC treatments basically treat the symptoms, not the underlying cause(s). My adult daughter began taking Rainbow Light's prenatal vitamins a few years ago before the birth of her second child. She has also suffered from mouth ulcers since childhood. When she told me she had not had any mouth ulcers since beginnning the vitamins, I compared the ingredients of the prenatal vitamin with Rainbow Light's other vitamin/mineral supplements. I also checked on the web for any new information and learned that some people's issues might rest in a B12 or Iron deficiency. I already take B12 (injections), and I am anemic from time to time, so I thought an iron deficiency might be part of my problem. I began taking Rainbow Light's Adult Active vitamins and added Complete Iron mini-tabs. I began this regimen in July of 2015, a  month after a very bad attack of mouth ulcers following an unidentified virus in June that had me in the ER during a vacation. Since that time, I have had a few mouth ulcers, just a few, and the ulcers I have had have been much smaller, less painful, and healed more quickly than in the past. Usually, I would get at least two or three small ones once or twice a month (not with a menses period; I am post-menopausal), and a more severe attack (more ulcers and much larger, making it difficult to eat). It's also worth mentioning that I have taken iron in the past to help with occasional anemia, but the iron tablets always upset my stomach, even when I took them with food. I have not had a single problem with the Complete Iron tablets, not even when I've taken the tablet with the RL multi-vitamin without food. I highly recommend these tablets if you need iron. I also highly recommend Rainbow Light's Adult Active multi-vitamins.

title: These iron pills do NOT cause constipation. Every other ...
body: These iron pills do NOT cause constipation.  Every other iron supplement product I have tried causes constipation.  And unlike prescription iron pills I have had to take during pregnancy, these natural iron pills actually raise all of my TIBC (iron counts) in my blood tests.  You will see concrete positive results within 30 days of taking these pills for 30 days.

title: Little to no side effect
body: I knew nothing about the benefits of iron until one person suggested I  might be deficient. I was always exhausted, the dark circles under my eyes made me look like the grim reaper, and I had out of control migraines. Thinking I'd try to see if iron was the culprit, I purchased this particular brand by chance; though I'm not disappointed. On days when I take this supplement in the morning, there is a noticeable difference in my energy level and appearance, and the migraines have at least lessened somewhat. I've also experienced no nausea or other side effects with this brand, despite having heard horror stories about iron supplements from family and friends. Some reviewers here warn against constipation, but I haven't experienced a noticeable change. If this is a concern, my suggestion would be to incorporate gentle Miralax, or similar supplement and increase your water consumption. I typically take the supplement on an empty stomach with water in the morning, followed by a protein shake or light breakfast in about an hour.
