title: Little to no side effect
body: I knew nothing about the benefits of iron until one person suggested I  might be deficient. I was always exhausted, the dark circles under my eyes made me look like the grim reaper, and I had out of control migraines. Thinking I'd try to see if iron was the culprit, I purchased this particular brand by chance; though I'm not disappointed. On days when I take this supplement in the morning, there is a noticeable difference in my energy level and appearance, and the migraines have at least lessened somewhat. I've also experienced no nausea or other side effects with this brand, despite having heard horror stories about iron supplements from family and friends. Some reviewers here warn against constipation, but I haven't experienced a noticeable change. If this is a concern, my suggestion would be to incorporate gentle Miralax, or similar supplement and increase your water consumption. I typically take the supplement on an empty stomach with water in the morning, followed by a protein shake or light breakfast in about an hour.

title: Worked well Alone and With Ferret's Iron
body: These are really some great Iron pills! in early 2013, I was having issues with my hair thining and finally I told my primary care doctor to send me to an endocrinologist to be tested since she couldn't really give me reasonable answers to my issue. After getting a full panel of blood work done and having it indicate that I almost had no iron in my body, I spoke to my my brother (who is a health enthusiast) and he told me to look into the issue of thinning hair and low iron in women. Low and behold, I found a lot of information about women's thinning hair issues and having low iron without anemia. I went back to the endocronolgist armed with my research and she too confirmed that having such low iron could be contributing to my issue so she prescribed me 325mg of ferrous sulfate (which equals 130mg of elemental iron). This dosage is 600% more than the daily recommended iron dose for women! Yes,  my iron was that low... As i looked back over previous blood test from my annual physical exams, apparently it had been like that for years, but because the ferritin level was at the very bottom end of the very wide range or big gap of what is considered normal, my Dr didn't bother to mention any concern for the issue. This is why, to some degree, I've learned that you really have to take your healthcare in your own hands. Anyhow, after just taking  the prescription drugs for 2 or 3 days, my stomach was in so much pain that I had to leave work a few times. The prescription drugs also causes you to be very constipated. The endocrinologist told me that I would have to take those pills about a year to get my iron and ferritin levels up to par, but I knew there was no way in hell I was going to suffer taking those pills for a whole year because they debilated my quality of life just that much. So, I started looking for alternatives immediately and I came across these pills. I began taking them about 30 days before my next blood test and as I took them, I had no stomach cramping, no feeling of nausea and best of all, I wasn't constipated at all. However, you must have something on your stomach before taking them because they can make your stomach upset a little if it's empty. To put this review in perspetive, in Aug 2013 before taking these pills my ferrition was 11.6 on a scale of 11.0-307 and my iron was 27 on a scale of 50-212. When I went back in about 30 days to have my blood re-tested my ferritin had increased to 17 and my iron had increased to 142! That was amazing to me! Research says that you need to get ferritin levels up to at least 70 for several months before any significant change with hair can be seen, but I will say that just taking these pills alone (2 pills 2x per day) definitely was a big help! However, because I needed way more iron to build of my iron stores (i.e. ferritin, since it's the hardest to build up)  and I didn't want to pop these pills all day long, I now take these along wth Ferrett's Iron Supplement because you get 106 elemetal iron in one pill with the Ferret's brand iron. In early Oct 2013, I began taking 2 of the Now iron pills first thing in the morning with a tangerine (Vitamin C helps increase absoption) and 2 hours before having any dairy (dairy decreases iron absorbtion). And at night, I take 1 Ferretts Iron Supplement pill and one 1000mg of Vitamin C tablet before I go to bed and I am delighted to report that my 3rd  blood test that I took on Nov 6, 2013 revealed that my iron level is now 168 and my ferritin is 49.9. I am very glad that I choose the natural alterntative to increase my iron levels and if you try either of these two products, you will be glad too! If you don't need as much iron as I do, then these pills may work just fine for you.

title: best iron supplement you can buy "quality/$ wise"

We use other NOW brand supplements in our household, so I already knew this would be a product I could trust, thanks to the brand name. It's a high quality product, there are a couple different types of iron that's used in supplements, and the ferrous type (thats used in this one) has a better absorption rate than other iron supplements (you would have to take a higher dose, milligram wise, to get the same amount of iron) so considering that as well, made this #1 on our list when it came time to choose and buy. I've actually started to take this supplement as well, in addition to my multi-vitamin/stack. It's a good product, high quality...and a good value, $ wise. I would recommend this product to anyone who needs to take an iron supplement, and I plan on buying this product again when the time comes.

title: Great Supplement!
body: After dealing with fatigue and erratic heartbeats for months I was finally told by the doctor I was anemic due to my weight loss and dieting. My doctor wanted me to go on 100mg or higher iron tablets but after some research I found that levels that high can be dangerous and that women only need 18mg a day. That's when I found this. A nice, low dose iron supplement that's gentle on your stomach. I've had no constipation, no upset tummy, and my energy levels are much higher even though I've only been taking them for a few days! These capsules really are great! I'd recommend them to anyone who needs a little kick because they lack essential iron in their diet. I've also started taking a vitamin C tablet in the morning along with my iron to help the absorption and it's working great!

title: Great product that I will be purchasing again.
body: There are many medications out there that recommend minimizing your intake of Vitamin C, as it can prevent your body from fully absorbing said medication. This is true for myself with my ADHD medication, without which I have severe debilitating panic attacks. I decided to give this a try as I had recently become mildly anemic. I take this supplement at night just before bed, and my other medications in the morning when I first wake up. I have seen absolutely NO changes in the effectiveness of my medications, and I still receive all the benefits from the iron, b-vitamins, and copper from this supplement. I couldn't be happier!
